## GAD-7 vs CASI

Are you looking to measure and compare anxiety expressions in your clients using well-known psychological instruments such as GAD-7 and CASI? Understanding the nuanced differences and similarities between the two can provide deeper insights into the nature and magnitude of the anxiety your clients are experiencing. Here, we talk about GAD-7 vs CASI, and how Harmony can offer a scientific, efficient comparison between them, enhancing your research and outcomes. The Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Children's Anxiety Sensitivity Index (CASI) are extensively used instruments in the field of psychology. Both serve the purpose of identifying and measuring anxiety among individuals but have differing approaches, using unique clusters of questions. Leveraged by psychologists worldwide, the comparison of GAD-7 vs CASI has frequently sparked discussions, driving the need for an effective tool to harmonise these questionnaires. Here comes the role of Harmony. Harmony, a sophisticated software using natural language processing and generative AI models, seamlessly harmonises the itemised questions from both instruments, regardless of the language they are in. It empowers you to compare and match intricacies of each item in GAD-7 and CASI, with results quantified into percentage matches. This makes the GAD-7 vs CASI analysis more accurate, objective and beneficial, saving your extensive effort and time in manual harmonisation. Visit Harmony's web interface and start comparing these questionnaires today!

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and CASI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and CASI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CASI into Harmony</a> - compare CASI with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
